title: Chained consumer price index of all urban consumers 2000 to 2019
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) for 20 number of December values.
December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) and 2000 has the lowest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100).
There is a difference of 42.13 between the maximum December value 2019 and minimum December value 2000.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) for 20 number of December values.
The Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is appeared to be the highest at December value 2019 and lowest at December value 2000.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) for 20 number of December values.
December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) and 2000 has the lowest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100).

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing December value in the x axis and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in the y axis.
December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) and 2000 has the lowest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100).
Second maximum Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is found at December value .
The difference of Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) between the highest and lowest December value is 42.13.
The December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100), followed by , and 2017. Down to the December value 2000 which is the lowest.
The average Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in all 20 December values is 124.19.
